pr_title: Use .equals() on constants and literals to prevent NPEs

timeline.body:
This looks like a bug. How can `fileExtensionStartIndex` equals to -1 when we add 1 in the line before?

We should either do this:

```suggestion
        if (fileName.lastIndexOf(".") == -1) {
```

Or add one later in `fileName.substring(fileExtensionStartIndex + 1);

Maybe do it similar to `AbstractFileProvider#getParserType()`.
timeline.bodyHTML:
This looks like a bug. How can fileExtensionStartIndex equals to -1 when we add 1 in the line before?

We should either do this:

Suggested change
if (fileExtensionStartIndex == -1) {
if (fileName.lastIndexOf(".") == -1) {

Or add one later in `fileName.substring(fileExtensionStartIndex + 1);

Maybe do it similar to AbstractFileProvider#getParserType().
timeline.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: I think you're right so it's fixed now. 👍
replies.author: wborn

timeline.body: Store `fileName.lastIndexOf(".")` in a local variable earlier and reuse it here.
timeline.bodyText: Store fileName.lastIndexOf(".") in a local variable earlier and reuse it here.
timeline.bodyHTML: Store fileName.lastIndexOf(".") in a local variable earlier and reuse it here.
timeline.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: Done! And I threw the Elvis operator in the mix. ?:-)
